greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array T(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals, where T(n,k) is the number of k-step closed paths (from origin to origin) in 2-dimensional lattice, using steps (t_1,t_2) (|t_1| + |t_2| = n).
comment: T(n,k) is the constant term in the expansion of (Sum_{j=0..n} (x^j + 1/x^j)*(y^(n-j) + 1/y^(n-j)) - x^n - 1/x^n - y^n - 1/y^n)^k for n > 0.
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Nov 04 2019
